title: Unless, Providing, Provided, And As Long As Exercise

questions.question: We can win the championship, .......................... we avoid bad injuries.
questions.description: Providing has a similar meaning to if.

questions.question: I will leave now, .............................. there is anything left to do now.
questions.description: Unless has a similar meaning to if not.

questions.question: We can hold the party in the garden ............................. it doesn't rain.
The public will be admitted to the galleries, ........................... they make a donation.
You can keep the puppy ................................... you promise to take care of it.
You can take my car ............................... you drive carefully.
questions.description: As long as and provided that mean 'on condition that'.

questions.question: I can't help you ............................ you tell me what is wrong.
questions.description: Unless means if not. The above sentence can also be written as: I can help you if you tell me what is wrong.

questions.question: I can help you ............................... you tell me what is wrong.
questions.description: Provided that means on condition that.

questions.question: He wouldn't eat anything .................................. he cooked it himself.
You can take this seat, ............................... no one has reserved it.
questions.description: Providing and as long as are possible here. They both mean 'on condition that'.

questions.question: My parents don't care who I marry .......................... I am happy.
You can go out now .............................. you finish your homework first.
questions.description: All of these expressions mean the same,
